image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann arrives at court, with reporters behind him.

props.synopsis: Ex-Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann takes the stand in defamation action brought by him against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson over coverage of allegations he raped his former colleague Brittany Higgins

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann takes the stand in defamation action against Network Ten, Lisa Wilkinson

image.altText: A poster with the words HOSTAGE DEAL CEASEFIRE is held in the air by an obscured hand

props.synopsis: Israel and Hamas have agreed to a four-day ceasefire in their war in exchange for the release of 50 women and children held in Gaza. Here's what we know about the deal and what may unfold next.

title.children: Israel and Hamas have reached a temporary ceasefire deal after six weeks of fighting. This is what we know about it

image.altText: a group of mostly men and young boys walk around on wet ground

props.synopsis: The Australian government has granted hundreds of temporary visas to Palestinians in the weeks since Israel began its bombing campaign of Gaza, which has killed thousands of civilians and flattened large swathes of the densely populated strip.

title.children: Government grants hundreds of temporary visas to Palestinians

image.altText: Minister for Foreign Affairs Penny Wong speaks to journalists in canberra on monday october 16, 2023

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong says 67 Australians, permanent residents and their families crossed through the Rafah border crossing overnight. Follow live.

title.children: Wong confirms 67 Australians crossed from Gaza into Egypt overnight

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Penny Wong calls temporary ceasefire 'important and necessary'
Start of ceasefire will be announced in next 24 hours: Qatari foreign ministry
Government grants hundreds of temporary visas to Palestinians in Gaza

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann and Lisa Wilkinson.

props.synopsis: Before settling, Bruce Lehrmann was due to take on the ABC in the Federal Court in Sydney today. The former Liberal staffer's defamation action against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson continues.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's defamation action against Lisa Wilkinson, Network Ten begins after ABC settlement

image.altText: A man with a hose fights a fire.

props.synopsis: Firefighters are urgently responding to an emergency bushfire in Perth's southern suburbs that is threatening lives and homes on a sweltering spring day.

title.children: Freeway closed amid bushfire emergency in Perth's south as temperature climbs towards 40C

image.altText: A man in a suit and a grey face mask walks outside a court building.

props.synopsis: Muhammad Ali is sentenced to 18 months in prison after being found guilty of indecently touching a child at the centre where he worked.

title.children: Former Canberra childcare worker jailed for indecently touching young boy

image.altText: A woman outside the ACT Supreme Court.

props.synopsis: A female intruder who invaded the Canberra home of a former friend she believed had killed her dog, smashing furniture and attacking the victim, is sentenced to a nearly four-year intensive corrections order to be served in the community.

title.children: Canberra woman who attacked former friend she believed had killed her dog avoids further jail

image.altText: A wet wombat on a footpath near a body of water.

props.synopsis: A wombat earns the nickname, Ian Thorpe, after swimming for nearly 40 minutes before being rescued by a woman in a kayak from Yerrabi Pond in Canberra's north after a thunderstorm.

title.children: Wombat nicknamed Ian Thorpe after being rescued from Canberra pond by woman in kayak

image.altText: A young man holding a film camera.

props.synopsis: Family and friends of 30-year-old camera operator James Rose and 56-year-old pilot Stephen Gale pay tribute to the two men, as authorities continue to investigate the cause of Sunday's mid-air plane crash over Melbourne's Port Phillip bay.

title.children: Family mourns 'one of a kind' camera operator after plane crash remains found by police

image.altText: A dated image of a happy smiling woman.

props.synopsis: A Perth court has been told a 77-year-old man will maintain he is innocent of murdering a woman who vanished in Perth almost 40 years ago.

title.children: Man charged with 1986 murder of Perth mother Sharon Fulton says he will fight charge

image.altText: A smiling man sitting on the rung of a helicopter in grassland, wearing a trucker cap and bright blue ag worker shirt.

props.synopsis: In its report, the ATSB found the helicopter likely crashed because of fuel exhaustion resulting in engine stoppage.

title.children: ATSB releases final report into chopper crash that killed Netflix star Chris 'Willow' Wilson

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A man with a grey beard and black cap and a blonde woman resting her hand on his shoulder smile in a radio studio.

props.synopsis: A deal signed by the hosts of The Kyle and Jackie O Show will also see Sydney's top-rating radio breakfast program broadcast in Melbourne from 2024, and follows their employer launching a takeover bid of their former network.

title.children: Kyle and Jackie O are controversial, but their 'commercial success' will keep them on air until the end of 2034

image.altText: Woman sits at a desk looking at a calculator and bills, a man is standing behind her on the phone, both look stressed

props.synopsis: Australians are more dissatisfied with their economic situation than ever before, with young people particularly downbeat. Meanwhile, the ASX has posted modest falls. Follow the day's financial news and insights from our specialist business reporters on our live blog.

title.children: Australians are more dissatisfied with their economic situation than ever before; ASX edges lower

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Binance's $US4b fine unlikely to affect Australian crypto investors, experts say
Long-term study shows record low economic satisfaction and growing generational divide
ASX fairly flat as more sectors gain

image.altText: A composite image of a father and son, and a couple and their daughter

props.synopsis: The families of five people killed in a crash outside a regional Victorian pub are told it could take a long time for any case to be finalised.

title.children: Police yet to decide whether to charge driver in fatal Daylesford pub crash, court told

image.altText: Faisal holds a banner calling for help while his wife and children stand with him

props.synopsis: Men who spent years in detention on Manus Island living in the hope of resettlement now face being evicted from their temporary homes.

title.children: These refugees were detained for years on Manus Island. Now they're caught between three countries

image.altText: A man in a navy suit crouches down to lay a wreath at a memorial to a police officer who died on duty.

props.synopsis: Less than a week after Brevet Sergeant Jason Doig was killed near Bordertown, hundreds of Lucindale residents and police have paid tribute to the "good man" who they say gave the ultimate sacrifice.

title.children: Locals lay wreaths as police and small SA town mourn fallen police officer

image.altText: Basil Zempilas Perth Lord Mayor

props.synopsis: The fight over the looming closure of a critical women's crisis centre in Perth next week escalates, with Lord Mayor Basil Zempilas insisting it is what his community wants.

title.children: Basil Zempilas defends women's crisis centre closure, citing resident's 'violence, drunkenness' fears

image.altText: A black and white photo of The Cruel Sea

props.synopsis: The frontman on joining his favourite band, playing Daytona with Mick Jagger, and that missing ARIA story.

title.children: 'We weren't sure it would ever happen': Tex Perkins on The Cruel Sea's first reunion in over a decade

image.altText: A person holding a degree.

props.synopsis: Education ministers from around the country are proposing major changes at universities to bring down rates of sexual violence in tertiary education settings.

title.children: State and territory governments put forward plan to curb sexual assaults at universities

image.altText: A bald man of Chinese heritage wearing glasses and a black polo shirt holds a microphone in front of a yellow backdrop.

props.synopsis: The founder of Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, pleads guilty to money laundering charges and stepped down as CEO.

title.children: 'Line in the sand': Australian industry lauds conviction of second global cryptocurrency kingpin

image.altText: A hand holding a credit card out towards a recipient.

props.synopsis: The Australian Bureau of Statistics survey finds around 16 per cent of women have experienced some form of economic abuse. A leading women's advocate says it's a form of abuse that too often is flying under the radar.

title.children: Linda's relationship 'didn't feel bad enough to leave' — but she was experiencing economic abuse

image.altText: A Banksy mural of a man throwing a bunch of flowers is pictured inside three gold frames.

props.synopsis: Recorded before Banksy's 2003 show Turf Wars, the interviewer asks the artist about whether his name is Robert Banks. "It's Robbie," he replies.

title.children: Unheard cut of 20-year-old interview with 'Banksy' appears to confirm his name — but is it all a joke?

image.altText: A soccer player wearing blue and yellow takes a photo with her girlfriend after a match

props.synopsis: After months of speculation, Matildas star Sam Kerr shares photos from the moment she proposed to her long-term girlfriend, American professional soccer player Kristie Mewis.

title.children: Matildas star Sam Kerr shares glimpse of the moment she proposed to partner Kristie Mewis

image.altText: A close up of a hand holding a mobile phone, which is displaying an apology to customers written on the Optus website.

props.synopsis: Submissions to a Senate inquiry outline what happened behind the scenes as Optus rushed to fix its recent outage.

title.children: Urgent meetings, router resets and 400 workers: Behind the scenes of the Optus outage

image.altText: An Aboriginal man wearing a cap holds a small painting

props.synopsis: Groote Eylandt's Indigenous communities celebrate the return of 174 artefacts from the Manchester Museum, saying the move has encouraged them to start making and using them again.

title.children: 'Special day' as artefacts collected from Groote Eylandt 70 years ago returned to Anindilyakwa

image.altText: A split image showing two young heat-exhausted women and the pop star Taylor Swift performing.

props.synopsis: The heat index – or "feels like" – temperature reportedly reached 59C in Rio de Janeiro as thousands of fans queued up for Taylor Swift's performance.

title.children: The heat was brutal at Taylor Swift's tragic Rio concert. One factor made it even more dangerous

image.altText: High school students sitting in a classroom using laptops

props.synopsis: At the start of 2023, experts warned ChatGPT would swamp schools in a wave of cheating. With the academic year wrapping up, we asked students what really happened.

title.children: ChatGPT was tipped to cause widespread cheating. Here's what students say happened

image.altText: Pat Riley stands in front of red dirt cliffs in the Kimberley and looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: In 2021, Telstra faced court for its treatment of First Nations customers. New figures obtained by the ABC show the scale of the problem is much worse than first thought.

title.children: This mother feared she would end up in jail over huge phone bills, a problem experts say is greater than first thought

image.altText: Bottle caps of varying sizes with nails in them.

props.synopsis: The discovery of homemade bottle cap spikes placed in an 'obvious' manner on a residential street has sparked concern for road users, including children on bikes.

title.children: Bottle cap spikes found in Broken Hill sparks safety concerns for road users

image.altText: Five ducks walking in between green vineyard row.

props.synopsis: After introducing the birds last growing season as a trial, Castle Rock Estate is using them again this year with hopes to grow the flock.

title.children: Winery deploys ducks to help reduce vineyard snails and cut input costs
